Job Title: Territory Manager - Utah South (Wasatch Front)

Location: Utah, United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Business Development, Sales

Description:
GROW WITH US: 

Tandem Diabetes Care creates new possibilities for people living with diabetes, their loved ones, and their healthcare providers through a positively different experience. We’d love for you to team up with us to “innovate every day,” put “people first,” and take a “no-shortcuts” approach that has propelled us to become a leader in the diabetes technology industry.

STAY AWESOME:

Tandem Diabetes Care is proud to manufacture and sell the t:slim X2 insulin pump with Control-IQ technology. We’re also so much more than that. Our company’s human-centered approach to design, development, and support delivers innovative products and services for people who use insulin. Since many of our own team members live with type 1 diabetes, or have a loved one impacted by diabetes, the work is personal, and we are committed to the cause. Learn more at tandemdiabetes.com.

A DAY IN THE LIFE:

You'll be directly responsible for the promotion of Tandem Diabetes products and services within your territory in partnership with a Clinical Diabetes Sales Specialist. Your goal will to be ensure the territory meets and exceeds company sales goals as established by management. You'll do this by leading strategic business planning, identifying potential customers, establishing, and developing business relationships to facilitate the sale of Tandem products and services. Additionally, you'll use your industry sales experience to provide account sales support and continuing education to patients, physicians, and their Clinical Educators on the technical use of insulin pump therapy.

This is a field-based position which will be responsible for our Utah South Territory. Ideal candidates for this opportunity will reside in/around the Wasatch Front area – this territory will be part of Salt Lake City and down to Utah County.

YOU’RE AWESOME AT:

BS/BA from a four-year college or university plus 3 years of related industry sales experience; preferably in one or more of the following areas: diabetes, endocrinology, insulin infusion pumps, and managed care. Equivalent combination of education and experience will also be considered.Ability to travel at least 80% in your assigned territory; must maintain a valid driver's license and required auto insurance as well as good driving record, per company policy.Motivation and drive to meet and even exceed sales goals.Ability to relate effectively with patients, referral sources and health care professionals.Demonstrated ability to effectively communicate with customers to resolve issues and answer questions according to company protocols and requirements. Ability to assert own ideas and persuade others through effectively consolidating, evaluating, and presenting relevant information.Skilled at promoting team cooperation and commitment to team success.Ability to work in a fast paced, ever-changing market and see change as an opportunity to improve business performance and will campaign for it when necessary.

WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU?

In addition to innovative technology, we have a culture that fosters the idea that the happiest people are the most productive people. Not only do we hire forward-thinking achievers to join our workforce; we reward, develop, and retain them too. Just one of the many reasons of how we #StayAwesome! To learn more about our culture and benefits please visit https://www.tandemdiabetes.com/careers.

BE YOU, WITH US!

Tandem is firmly committed to being an equal opportunity employer and maintaining a diverse and inclusive environment. We value and embrace that every single one of us brings value to the table. But sometimes we forget that when we don’t meet 100% of a job description’s criteria – maybe you’re feeling that way right now? We encourage you to apply anyway. Because we want you to be you, with us.

Due to requirements of some health systems and/or local municipalities, vaccines, including the COVID-19 vaccine, may be a requirement of this job. Tandem will consider reasonable accommodations.

COMPENSATION & BENEFITS: 

The starting base pay range for this position is $75,900 - $94,800 annually plus incentive compensation (commission-based compensation is based on the achievement of goals). Base pay will vary based on job-related knowledge, skills, experience and may also fluctuate depending on candidate’s location and the overall job market. In addition to base pay, Tandem offers a competitive compensation package that includes bonus, equity, and a robust benefits package. 

Tandem offers health care benefits such as medical, dental, vision, health savings accounts and flexible saving accounts. You’ll also receive 10 paid holidays per year, a minimum of 20 days of paid time off (starting in year 1) and have access to a 401k plan with company match. Learn more about Tandem’s benefits here!

YOU SHOULD KNOW: 

Potential new employees must successfully complete a drug screen (excludes marijuana) and background check which includes criminal search, education certification and employment verification prior to hire.

REFERRALS: 

We love a good referral! If you know someone that would be a great fit for this position, please share!

If you are applying for this job and live in California, please read Tandem’s CCPA Notice:

https://www.tandemdiabetes.com/careers/california-consumer-privacy-act-notice-for-job-applicants

APPLICATION DEADLINE: 

The position will be posted until a final candidate is selected for the requisition or the requisition has a sufficient number of applications.

SPONSORHSIP: 

Applicants must be authorized to work for any employer in the U.S. We are unable to sponsor or take over sponsorship of an employment Visa at this time.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
